TypeSignature.Value: public abstract class WebResponse : MarshalByRefObject, IDisposable, System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable
.class public auto ansi abstract serializable beforefieldinit WebResponse extends System.MarshalByRefObject implements class System.IDisposable, class System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable

Docs.summary: Provides a response from a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI). This is an class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> class is the `abstract` base class from which protocol-specific response classes are derived. Applications can participate in request and response transactions in a protocol-agnostic manner using instances of the <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> class while protocol-specific classes derived from <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> carry out the details of the request.
Client applications do not create <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> objects directly; they are created by calling the <xref:System.Net.WebRequest.GetResponse%2A> method on a <xref:System.Net.WebRequest> instance.
## Examples The following example creates a <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> instance from a <xref:System.Net.WebRequest>.
[!code-cpp[Classic WebRequest Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic WebRequest Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Classic WebRequest Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic WebRequest Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic WebRequest Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic WebRequest Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

block.para: When you inherit from , you must override the following members: , , , , and .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Applications do not call the <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> constructor directly; use the <xref:System.Net.WebRequest.GetResponse%2A> method on a <xref:System.Net.WebRequest> instance.

block.para: This constructor creates and initializes the required fields for descendant classes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When implemented by a descendant class, this constructor implements the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable> interface for the <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> descendant.

Docs.exception: Any attempt is made to access the constructor, when the constructor is not overridden in a descendant class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Close() cil managed

Docs.summary: When overridden by a descendant class, closes the response stream.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.WebResponse.Close%2A> method cleans up the resources used by a <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> and closes the underlying stream by calling the <xref:System.IO.Stream.Close%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
> [!NOTE] > The response must be closed to avoid running out of system resources. The response stream can be closed by calling <xref:System.IO.Stream.Close%2A?displayProperty=fullName> or <xref:System.Net.WebResponse.Close%2A>.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> class is an `abstract` class. The actual behavior of <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> instances at run time is determined by the descendant class returned by <xref:System.Net.WebRequest.GetResponse%2A?displayProperty=fullName>. For more information about default values and exceptions, please see the documentation for the descendant classes, such as <xref:System.Net.HttpWebResponse> and <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse>.
## Examples The following example uses the <xref:System.Net.WebResponse.Close%2A> method to close the `WebResponse`.
[!code-cpp[WebResponse_close#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebResponse_Close/CPP/webresponse_close.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[WebResponse_close#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebResponse_Close/CS/webresponse_close.cs#1)] [!code-vb[WebResponse_close#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebResponse_Close/VB/webresponse_close.vb#1)]

Docs.exception: Any attempt is made to access the method, when the method is not overridden in a descendant class.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual long ContentLength { get; set; }

Docs.summary: When overridden in a descendant class, gets or sets the content length of data being received.
Docs.value: The number of bytes returned from the Internet resource.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.WebResponse.ContentLength%2A> property contains the length, in bytes, of the response from the Internet resource. For request methods that contain header information, the <xref:System.Net.WebResponse.ContentLength%2A> does not include the length of the header information.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> class is an `abstract` class. The actual behavior of <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> instances at run time is determined by the descendant class returned by <xref:System.Net.WebRequest.GetResponse%2A?displayProperty=fullName>. For more information about default values and exceptions, please see the documentation for the descendant classes, such as <xref:System.Net.HttpWebResponse> and <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse>.
## Examples The following example uses the <xref:System.Net.WebResponse.ContentLength%2A> property to obtain the Length of the resource returned.
[!code-cpp[WebResponse_ContentLength_Type#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebResponse_ContentLength_Type/CPP/webresponse_contentlength_type.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[WebResponse_ContentLength_Type#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebResponse_ContentLength_Type/CS/webresponse_contentlength_type.cs#1)] [!code-vb[WebResponse_ContentLength_Type#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebResponse_ContentLength_Type/VB/webresponse_contentlength_type.vb#1)]

Docs.exception: Any attempt is made to get or set the property, when the property is not overridden in a descendant class.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string ContentType { get; set; }

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets or sets the content type of the data being received.
Docs.value: A string that contains the content type of the response.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.WebResponse.ContentType%2A> property contains the MIME content type of the response from the Internet resource, if known.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> class is an `abstract` class. The actual behavior of <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> instances at run time is determined by the descendant class returned by <xref:System.Net.WebRequest.GetResponse%2A?displayProperty=fullName>. For more information about default values and exceptions, please see the documentation for the descendant classes, such as <xref:System.Net.HttpWebResponse> and <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse>.
## Examples The following example uses the <xref:System.Net.WebResponse.ContentType%2A> property to obtain the content type of the response.
[!code-cpp[WebResponse_ContentLength_Type#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebResponse_ContentLength_Type/CPP/webresponse_contentlength_type.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[WebResponse_ContentLength_Type#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebResponse_ContentLength_Type/CS/webresponse_contentlength_type.cs#1)] [!code-vb[WebResponse_ContentLength_Type#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebResponse_ContentLength_Type/VB/webresponse_contentlength_type.vb#1)]

Docs.exception: Any attempt is made to get or set the property, when the property is not overridden in a descendant class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Dispose() cil managed

Docs.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void Dispose(bool disposing) cil managed

Docs.param: to release both managed and unmanaged resources; to releases only unmanaged resources.
Docs.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the object, and optionally disposes of the managed resources.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is called by the public `Dispose()` method and the <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> method. `Dispose()` invokes the protected `Dispose(Boolean)` method with the `disposing` parameter set to `true`. <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> invokes `Dispose` with `disposing` set to `false`.
When the `disposing` parameter is `true`, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> references. This method invokes the `Dispose()` method of each referenced object.
> [!NOTE] > This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md).

Docs.param: A that specifies the destination for this serialization.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Any objects included in the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo> are automatically tracked and serialized by the formatter.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.IO.Stream GetResponseStream() cil managed

Docs.summary: When overridden in a descendant class, returns the data stream from the Internet resource.
Docs.returns: An instance of the class for reading data from the Internet resource.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.WebResponse.GetResponseStream%2A> method returns the data stream from the Internet resource.
> [!NOTE] > The response stream must be closed to avoid running out of system resources. The response stream can be closed by calling <xref:System.IO.Stream.Close%2A?displayProperty=fullName> or <xref:System.Net.WebResponse.Close%2A>
## Examples The following example uses <xref:System.Net.WebResponse.GetResponseStream%2A> to return a <xref:System.IO.StreamReader> instance. A small local buffer is used to read data from the <xref:System.IO.StreamReader> and output it to the console.
[!code-cpp[WebResponse_GetResponseStream#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebResponse_GetResponseStream/CPP/webresponse_getresponsestream.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[WebResponse_GetResponseStream#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebResponse_GetResponseStream/CS/webresponse_getresponsestream.cs#1)] [!code-vb[WebResponse_GetResponseStream#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebResponse_GetResponseStream/VB/webresponse_getresponsestream.vb#1)]

Docs.exception: Any attempt is made to access the method, when the method is not overridden in a descendant class.

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a collection of header name-value pairs associated with this request.
Docs.value: An instance of the class that contains header values associated with this response.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.WebResponse.Headers%2A> property contains the name-value header pairs returned in the response.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> class is an `abstract` class. The actual behavior of <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> instances at run time is determined by the descendant class returned by <xref:System.Net.WebRequest.GetResponse%2A?displayProperty=fullName>. For more information about default values and exceptions, please see the documentation for the descendant classes, such as <xref:System.Net.HttpWebResponse> and <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse>.
## Examples The following example displays all of the header name-value pairs returned in the <xref:System.Net.WebResponse>.
[!code-cpp[WebResponse_Headers#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebResponse_Headers/CPP/webresponse_headers.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[WebResponse_Headers#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebResponse_Headers/CS/webresponse_headers.cs#1)] [!code-vb[WebResponse_Headers#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebResponse_Headers/VB/webresponse_headers.vb#1)]

Docs.exception: Any attempt is made to get or set the property, when the property is not overridden in a descendant class.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether this response was obtained from the cache.
Docs.value: if the response was taken from the cache; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The current cache policy and the presence of the requested resource in the cache determine whether a response can be retrieved from the cache. Using cached responses usually improves application performance, but there is a risk that the response in the cache does not match the response on the server. Use the <xref:System.Net.WebRequest.CachePolicy%2A> property to set and the <xref:System.Net.Cache.RequestCachePolicy> class to enumerate the current caching policy.
Note that getting this property can throw <xref:System.ObjectDisposedException>.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether mutual authentication occurred.
Docs.value: if both client and server were authenticated; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks To request mutual authentication, set the <xref:System.Net.WebRequest.AuthenticationLevel%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property using the <xref:System.Net.Security.AuthenticationLevel.MutualAuthRequested> or <xref:System.Net.Security.AuthenticationLevel.MutualAuthRequired> enumeration value. The default value for the <xref:System.Net.WebRequest.AuthenticationLevel%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property contains <xref:System.Security.Principal.TokenImpersonationLevel.Delegation> and <xref:System.Net.Security.AuthenticationLevel.MutualAuthRequested>.
Note that getting this property can throw <xref:System.ObjectDisposedException>.
## Examples The following code example checks the value of this property.
[!code-cpp[NclCredPolicy#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLCredPolicy/CPP/NCLCredPolicy.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[NclCredPolicy#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLCredPolicy/CS/websample.cs#1)]

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the URI of the Internet resource that actually responded to the request.
Docs.value: An instance of the class that contains the URI of the Internet resource that actually responded to the request.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.WebResponse.ResponseUri%2A> property contains the URI of the Internet resource that actually provided the response data. This resource might not be the originally requested URI if the underlying protocol allows redirection of the request.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> class is an `abstract` class. The actual behavior of <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> instances at run time is determined by the descendant class returned by <xref:System.Net.WebRequest.GetResponse%2A?displayProperty=fullName>. For more information about default values and exceptions, please see the documentation for the descendant classes, such as <xref:System.Net.HttpWebResponse> and <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse>.
## Examples The following example uses the <xref:System.Net.WebResponse.ResponseUri%2A> property to determine the location from which the <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> originated.
[!code-cpp[WebResponse_ResponseUri#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebResponse_ResponseUri/CPP/webresponse_responseuri.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[WebResponse_ResponseUri#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebResponse_ResponseUri/CS/webresponse_responseuri.cs#1)] [!code-vb[WebResponse_ResponseUri#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebResponse_ResponseUri/VB/webresponse_responseuri.vb#1)]

Docs.exception: Any attempt is made to get or set the property, when the property is not overridden in a descendant class.

Docs.value:
Returns .
if headers are supported; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is always true for [!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)].
